text.p: Lithuanian newspapers carried the following reports in their Thursday editions. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy:

- Former leader of the Lithuanian Democratic Labour Party and current president Algirdas Brazauskas, Wladimiras Beriozovas and Algis Klimaitis, accused of cooperation with the KGB, were partners in founding a company AWA in Germany earlier in the 1990s. The president's office said Brazauskas sold his shares in the company at the end of 1992.

- Former prime minister Adolfas Slezevicius and now a consultant for German food processing company GEA said he does not intend to return to politics since "it is very dirty thing". He said he enjoyed the freedom of private life and forecast his former party won 25 percent of seats in parliament in parliamentary elections in October.

- Defence Minister Linas Linkevicius told journalists after returning from the NATO meeting in Copenhagen that the conference settled his worries that the Baltic states would be left aside by NATO expansion.
- The U.N. Human Developement Report- 96 on Lithuania showed that although the economic decline is over in Lithuania, living standards of the majority of the population remains very low.
- Lithuanian parliament decided to punish those avoiding paying taxes to Social Insurance and Pension Fund SODRA with up to four years of imprisonment.
- Lithuanian Government decided to start the heating season when the average temperature for three days in a row is lower than eight degrees celsius but it will not be earlier than October 1.
- The newspaper continues its article on the Ignalina nuclear power plant safety and security problems and describes the contribution of the British firm NNC, working for three years at the plant.

- The right-wing opposition party Homeland Union economy experts criticise the litas reliability law and the currency board model in Lithuania. They say that the litas should be unpegged from the dollar but that the central bank, the Bank of Lithuania, should regain all the functions of a central bank and that the the devaluation of the litas should not be allowed.
